CONJUGATES: good/well (positive) | better (comparative) | best (superlative, adj/adv) | bests | bested | besting (verb)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English betst, superlative of gōd (good) and well. Germanic origin.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Of the most excellent, effective, or desirable quality, standard, or rank.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 最好的；最优秀的；最理想的；品质最高的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: This is undoubtedly the best movie of the year.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这无疑是今年最好的电影。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In the most excellent or most effective manner; to the greatest degree (superlative of 'well').
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 最好地；以最佳方式；最彻底地。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She sings best when she performs live.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她在现场表演时唱得最好。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The highest level of effort or achievement one can manage.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 最好的事物；最佳状态；竭尽全力。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Always give your best in every situation.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在任何情况下都要做到最好，竭尽全力。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To defeat, surpass, or gain an advantage over someone in a contest or endeavor.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He bested his opponent easily in the final round.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他在最后一轮中轻松击败了对手。
